intro: Commitheca liebrechtsiana, commonly known as the Cape fynbos. It is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa, belonging to the family Rutaceae. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and is typically found in the fynbos vegetation type. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
